required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of a Multi-Level Smoking Cessation Program for High-Risk Women in Rural Communities
clinical_study.official_title: Break Free: Effectiveness of a Multi-Level Smoking Cessation Program Adapted for High-Risk Women in Rural Communities

lead_sponsor.agency: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

clinical_study.source: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

brief_summary.textblock: This phase IV trial examines the effectiveness of a multi-level smoking cessation program for high-risk women in rural communities. Cigarette smoking is a major risk factor for cervical cancer in women. Rural primary care practices and providers often lack the electronic health record support to pre-identify smokers for services, as well as lack the necessary counseling training and access to comprehensive cessation programs. Implementing evidence-based smoking cessation programs in rural Appalachia may decrease the rates of cigarette smoking and as a result decrease the rates of cervical cancer.

detailed_description.textblock:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVES:
I. Determine the effectiveness of a core component of an integrated cervical cancer prevention program designed to help female smokers quit by standardizing clinical practice supports and protocols. (Service outcomes) II. Determine satisfaction with the multilevel intervention. (Client outcomes) III. Test the sustainability of the multilevel intervention via training of providers and staff on counseling and billing for evidence-based smoking cessation services. (Implementation outcomes)
OUTLINE:
IMPLEMENTATION OF TOBACCO-USER IDENTIFICATION SYSTEM: Clinics and systems develop and implement minimally required electronic tracking and reporting systems for identification of smokers during months 1-12.
GROUP RANDOMIZED TRIAL: Providers and participants are randomized to 1 of 2 arms.
ARM I (EARLY ARM): Providers undergo training over 60 minutes to explain the Break Free program and basics of quitting smoking during months 13-24. Female smokers interested in quitting in the next 6 months will be referred to an in-person counseling session at the clinic. Participants then receive 4 phone counseling over 15-20 minutes with a trained tobacco treatment specialist.
ARM II (DELAYED ARM): Female smokers receive usual care during months 13-24. Providers undergo training over 60 minutes to explain the Break Free program and basics of quitting smoking during months 25-36. Female smokers interested in quitting in the next 6 months will be referred to an in-person counseling session at the clinic. Participants then receive 4 phone counseling over 15-20 minutes with a trained tobacco treatment specialist.

primary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of intervention - delivery of AAC
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: This provider-level outcome includes self-reported changes in the delivery of the Ask, Advise, and Connect (AAC).

primary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of intervention - referral rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: This provider-level outcome includes the rate of referrals to the in-clinic smoking cessation counselor.

primary_outcome.measure: Fidelity to the intervention: counseling calls
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day after phone counseling during the span of the intervention (one year)
primary_outcome.description: Measured by asking 10% of randomly selected women questions about content of the phone counseling.

primary_outcome.measure: Fidelity to the intervention: provider visits
primary_outcome.time_frame: At time of in person visit for a one week span, every other month during the span of the intervention (one year)
primary_outcome.description: Measured by self-administered, anonymous, post-provider visit surveys every other month by patients who were in the clinic for a visit during a one-week period. Patients will be asking whether the provider asked about tobacco use, if a smoker, advised the patient to quit, discussed cessation, and connected the smoker to counseling.

primary_outcome.measure: Sustainability of the intervention: clinic continuation of Break Free
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the span of the final phase of study (2 years)
primary_outcome.description: Measured by self-reported continuation of cessation counseling by clinic staff

primary_outcome.measure: Sustainability of the intervention: counseling sessions
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the span of the final phase of study (2 years)
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the number of counseling sessions billed for overall

primary_outcome.measure: Sustainability of the intervention: counseling sessions per smoker
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the span of the final phase of study (2 years)
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the number of counseling sessions billed for each individual smoker who has at least one session

primary_outcome.measure: Sustainability of the intervention: EHR documentation
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the span of the final phase of study (2 years)
primary_outcome.description: Measured by electronic health record documentation of tobacco use

primary_outcome.measure: Cost-effectiveness of intervention
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Will be assessed using standard costs by considering costs of each component including pharmacotherapy, clinic counselor time and training, smoking cessation counselor time and training, telephone and material costs, and other administrative costs.

primary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of intervention at increasing brief cessation counseling: Change over time
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months, 6 months, 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Will be assessed using patient post-visit surveys and see if they increase over time.

primary_outcome.measure: Point prevalence
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 days
primary_outcome.description: Measured using self-report of any tobacco use. Abstainers will be classified as those participants who self-report no use of tobacco during the past week.

primary_outcome.measure: Floating abstinence
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 days
primary_outcome.description: Defined as not smoking during any consecutive 7-day period since the last assessment. Self-reported by patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Prolonged abstinence
primary_outcome.time_frame: At each follow-up visit over the span of the intervention (1 year)
primary_outcome.description: Defined as no smoking after a two-week grace period from the quit date. Self-reported by patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Provider satisfaction
primary_outcome.time_frame: Mid-points of each provider arm during the intervention year (1 year)
primary_outcome.description: Measured via provider surveys

primary_outcome.measure: Staff satisfaction
primary_outcome.time_frame: Mid-points of each provider arm during the intervention year (1 year)
primary_outcome.description: Measured via staff surveys

primary_outcome.measure: Smoker satisfaction with Break Free counseling
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of each Break Free counseling sessions during the intervention year (year 1)
primary_outcome.description: Measured via patient surveys

primary_outcome.measure: Smoker satisfaction during Break Free counseling
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of each Break Free counseling sessions during the intervention year (year 1)
primary_outcome.description: Measured via patient surveys

primary_outcome.measure: Smoker satisfaction after Break Free program
primary_outcome.time_frame: At 6 months after completion of Break Free counseling
primary_outcome.description: Measured via patient surveys

primary_outcome.measure: Change in provider knowledge
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post-training (same day), 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Using the Theory of Planned Behavior (TPB) model, effectiveness of intervention on improved provider knowledge will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in provider attitudes
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post-training (1 day), 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Using the Theory of Planned Behavior (TPB) model, effectiveness of intervention on improved provider attitudes will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in provider's normative beliefs
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post-training (1 day), 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Using the Theory of Planned Behavior (TPB) model, effectiveness of intervention on provider's normative beliefs will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in provider's perceived behavioral control
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post-training (1 day), 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Using the Theory of Planned Behavior (TPB) model, effectiveness of intervention on provider's perceived behavioral control will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of intervention of Improved provider knowledge and attitude
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post-training (1 day), 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Using the Theory of Planned Behavior (TPB) model, attitudes, normative beliefs, and perceived behavioral control will be assessed.

arm_group.description: Providers undergo training over 60 minutes to explain the Break Free program and basics of quitting smoking during months 13-24. Female smokers interested in quitting in the next 6 months will be referred to an in-person counseling session at the clinic. Participants then receive 4 phone counseling over 15-20 minutes with a trained tobacco treatment specialist.

Female smokers receive usual care during months 13-24. Providers undergo training over 60 minutes to explain the Break Free program and basics of quitting smoking during months 25-36. Female smokers interested in quitting in the next 6 months will be referred to an in-person counseling session at the clinic. Participants then receive 4 phone counseling over 15-20 minutes with a trained tobacco treatment specialist.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- HEALTH SYSTEM/CLINIC
- Based in one of the Appalachian regions included in this program project
- Provides care to female smokers
- PROVIDER
- Practicing in one of the participating health systems
- Involved in patient care
- PATIENT
- Females
- Age 18 to 64
- Smokers who consume at least 5 cigarettes per day (less than the minimum in most cessation studies, yet still enough to show signs of nicotine dependence)
- Ready to quit smoking in the next 6 months
- English-speaking
- Able to participate in counseling
- Willing to try smoking cessation pharmacotherapy
- Not pregnant

overall_official.affiliation: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

facility.name: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center
